thread.title: Orioles re-sign outfielder Michael Bourn to minor league contract
thread.title_full: Orioles re-sign outfielder Michael Bourn to minor league contract

author: Eduardo A. Encina
title: Orioles re-sign outfielder Michael Bourn to minor league contract
text:
Orioles re-sign outfielder Michael Bourn to minor league contract Orioles spring training report 
Sun columnist Peter Schmuck and beat writer Eduardo Encina talk about the trade for Vidal Nuno and how it helps the team set up the roster for the upcoming season. (Video by Karl Merton Ferron/Baltimore Sun) 
Sun columnist Peter Schmuck and beat writer Eduardo Encina talk about the trade for Vidal Nuno and how it helps the team set up the roster for the upcoming season. (Video by Karl Merton Ferron/Baltimore Sun) Eduardo A. Encina roster on Monday night, re-signing veteran Michael Bourn to a minor league contract with an invitation to major league spring training.
Bourn, who will report to the club later this week, can make a base salary of $2 million if he makes the major league Opening Day roster. 
The addition of Bourn gives the Orioles added speed in the outfield and on the bases as well as much-needed on-base capability. 
Bourn was acquired last season in a late August trade with the Arizona Diamondbacks . 
In 24 games for the Orioles last season, Bourn hit .283 with two home runs and had a .358 on-base percentage.
